title: Lagoon Daybreak: A Boat Ride That Reset My Brain
excerpt: Blue water, quiet paddles, and one unexpected conversation that changed the whole day.
content: I’ve learned that the best travel moments are the ones you don’t schedule.
This morning started with a simple plan: get on the water early, before the wind wakes up.
By the end of the ride, the lagoon felt like a moving meditation.

title: Street Bites: How I Choose What to Eat (Without Regret)
excerpt: My simple decision system for street food: follow the smoke, follow the locals, follow the queue.
content: Street food is the fastest way to understand a city.
My rule: pick stalls with heat, speed, and repeat customers.
If you see a vendor serving the same dish all day, that’s usually a good sign.

title: My Travel Tech Pack: The 7 Things I Actually Use
excerpt: Minimal gear, maximum output: what stays in my bag for filming, editing, and backup.
content: I used to overpack tech. Now I run a small, reliable kit that never slows me down.
The goal is simple: record clean audio, keep footage safe, and edit anywhere.
If it doesn’t reduce friction, it doesn’t come with me.
